availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edwin Vincent (1st lieutenant, 5th Kentucky Cavalry (Co. D))

body.p: Kentucky farmer, and soldier. Married to Julia Ann B. Carver Vincent. Father of Margaret E. Vincent and Landers M. Vincent. Farmer in Cumberland County in 1860. First lieutenant in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from March 31, 1862 to May 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District 1, p. 31.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Carver Precinct, p. 14.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0058.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 118-119.
W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville: F. A. Battey and Company, 1887), 859-860.
Find A Grave, "Edwin Vincent (April 14, 1830-February 11, 1910)," Memorial #124814396, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124814396 (accessed May 8, 2017).
